messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

I inspected server.js, routes/productRoutes.js and controllers/productController.js and determined the concrete paths and which HTTP methods are explicitly handled by the code.

Notes about interpretation:
- server.js mounts productRoutes at the prefix /api/products, so all router paths are under that prefix.
- I did not assume Express implicit behaviors (e.g. automatic HEAD responses for GET); I only mark a method acceptable if the code explicitly registers a handler for it (router.get/post/put/delete/etc or router.route(...).<method>).
- No router.all or router.options or router.trace or router.head or router.patch registrations are present in the provided files.

Endpoints and allowed methods

1) Path: /api/products
- All methods allowed (router.all): false
- HEAD: false
- POST: true   (router.route('/').post(protect, admin, createProduct))
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true    (router.route('/').get(getProducts))
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

2) Path: /api/products/{id}
- All methods allowed: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true    (router.route('/:id').get(checkObjectId, getProductById))
- PUT: true    (router.route('/:id').put(protect, admin, checkObjectId, updateProduct))
- DELETE: true (router.route('/:id').delete(protect, admin, checkObjectId, deleteProduct))
- PATCH: false

3) Path: /api/products/{id}/reviews
- All methods allowed: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: true   (router.route('/:id/reviews').post(protect, checkObjectId, createProductReview))
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: false
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

4) Path: /api/products/top
- All methods allowed: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true    (router.get('/top', getTopProducts))
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Brief explanation of how these were derived:
- server.js line app.use('/api/products', productRoutes) sets the prefix /api/products for the router.
- productRoutes.js explicitly registers handlers:
  - router.route('/').get(...).post(...)
  - router.route('/:id/reviews').post(...)
  - router.get('/top', ...)
  - router.route('/:id').get(...).put(...).delete(...)
- controllers/productController.js contains the functions wired to those handlers, confirming which HTTP methods implement which controller logic.
- No explicit handlers for HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, PATCH or a router.all were found in the provided files, so they are marked unacceptable per the instruction to base answers only on the code.

message.content:
{
  "arbitrary": false,
  "delete": false,
  "get": true,
  "head": false,
  "options": false,
  "patch": false,
  "path": "/api/products",
  "post": true,
  "put": false,
  "trace": false
}
